stimulusHtml: Ancient Roman audiences would most likely have responded to the experience of entering the Pantheon in which of the following ways?

features.html: Â© Scala / Art Resource, NY

choicesHtml: With surprise, because the vast circular interior is not suggested by the columned rectilinear facade
With delight, because the interior originally held a massive chryselephantine statue of Athena
With pride, because the interior contained narrative friezes depicting the Roman army conquering barbarians
With reverence, because the dark interior would have been filled with incense and chanting to promote worship
